title: Unable to change default size for composing a message
content:
I went to Tools>Settings>Composition>HTML Style and specified a new Font Name. After a restart of TB the Font was correctly changed. But the Size did not change.

See Image.

Thanks for your help. SweetTasha
creator: sweettasha

title: cannot send emails
content:
I cannot get emails to send from Thunderbird. I have to copy to Outlook to be able to send.

Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Client not authenticated to send mail. [MW4PR04CA0246.namprd04.prod.outlook.com 2024-03-01T04:29:11.388Z 08DC38FAF1647BFB]. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again.
creator: alv7722

title: After adding "Received" as a new Header in Search, any searches on the Received header find no emails, even though there are numerous emails that match that data.
content:
I initially searched this forum for "Search Received" but got over 300 items. I tried refining the search but couldn't find any issues that matched this.

Before adding the Received Header I had found another article on here that said it was OK to add a search header using the Customize option. Is the Receive field a valid search criterion? If so, why isn't the search finding emails that match that criterion?
creator: TampaTom

title: Labels
content: Hello everyone, I have more than 30 labels and I also want to use them on my other computer. My question is how can I export/import my labels ?

title: How do I delete one of my many email adresses in Thunderbird?
content:
Hi,

I have four email adresses in my Thunderbird and now I would have to delete one of them, but it wasn't as easy as I thought it would be.

I tried right-clicking on the email address I wanted to delete, but it didn't work.

Then I went into settings but found nowhere where it said "delete email adress".

But on the other hand, under "Account actions" on the left side under all email addresses it said "Delete account". The problem here is that there weren't three dots after so I was afraid I would delete my entire Thunderbird if I clicked on this.

Where can I delete just ONE of my four email adresses?

Kind regards Carina
creator: kontakt395

title: "Thunderbird.app is damaged..."
content:
Hi,

I was reasonably up to date on Thunderbird, but just today (March 1) I've started getting this: "Thunderbird.app is damaged and can’t be opened. You should move it to the Trash. This file was downloaded on an unknown date." I'm attaching a screen capture. If I keep hitting "Cancel" about half a dozen times, the little panel stops. But it soon starts up again.

So I updated to 115.8.0 (Mac), but it didn't help. Will I lose my email files if I delete Thunderbird.app and re-install? (I'll make a copy of my Profile in any case.)

Do let me know, as that "?" item in the upper right corner of the panel is less than enlightening.

Thanks!

Peter
creator: kukisvoomchor

title: Date shown on threaded messages in Thunderbird
content: In the overall list of messages in the thunderbird inbox there are some threaded messages. That's OK so far. The problem is that the date shown is the date of the first single message, which started the thread. Any new message coming in does not change that date shown. Therefore I am not aware and cannot see that an additional message is received. How can I change the behavior such as the date of the newest message received will be shown? Thanks for any help Willi
creator: willi.fuchs

title: locate folder
content:
Dear Mozilla, after a few years I decided to support you - I have been a user sine Outlook Express died back in ... 2009. I found Thunderbird most attractive then, and now. Problem - SSD crash - reinstall Win 10, reinstall Thunderbird, locate folder: By experience, it is located on another harddisk (SSD) and a separate partion for communications, and a folder called 'Thunderbird'. ;-) However, re-installing Thunderbird and locating the folder, DOES NOT work. I am unable to read ANY of my old emails, decades back - important ones. Pleeeaase help. ;-(

-)
creator: arnomd

title: Profile.ini missing from TB?
content: Hi, TB is running extremely slowly on my Windows 10 PC. A lot of online advice suggests deleting or updating the old profile. ini file, but when I go to my default profile folder, there is no profile. ini file there. Could it be stored anywhere else? Anything else I can do to speed up TB? Thanks, ND
